questions.question_text: What are the two minimum configuration requirements for an outgoing interface to be selected once the SD-WAN logical interface is enabled? (Choose two.)

choices.B: Changes have been made on firewall policy ID 1 on FortiGate.
choices.C: Firewall policy ID 1 has source NAT disabled.
choices.D: FortiGate has terminated the session after a change on policy ID 1.
choices.A: The type of traffic defined and allowed on firewall policy ID 1 is UDP.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
I agree with B, even though the answer could also be wrong. Could have been a routing change and not a change on policy id 1 that dirtied the session.
But B is the most likely correct answer.

answer is B

https://community.fortinet.com/t5/FortiGate/Technical-Tip-Dirty-session/ta-p/197748

A dirty session is a session that must be re-evaluated by the kernel after it is impacted by a routing, firewall policy, or interface change. FortiGate performs route lookups for both original and reply traffic. Also, during route lookup, policy routes are also checked.

Selected Answer: B
B refer to SD-WAN_6.4_Study_Guide page 51
B . DIRTY MAY_DIRTY
Agree correct answer is B

questions.question_text: What are two reasons why FortiGate would be unable to complete the zero-touch provisioning process? (Choose two.)

choices.A: The FortiGate cloud key has not been added to the FortiGate cloud portal.
choices.C: FortiGate has obtained a configuration from the platform template in FortiGate cloud.
choices.B: FortiDeploy has connected with FortiGate and provided the initial configuration to contact FortiManager.
choices.E: The zero-touch provisioning process has completed internally, behind FortiGate.
choices.D: A factory reset performed on FortiGate.

discussion.content:

questions.question_text: Which two statements reflect the benefits of implementing the ADVPN solution to replace conventional VPN topologies? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: Isn't it Hub to Hub

Selected Answer: CD
CD refer to SD-WAN_6.4_Study_Guide page 205
correct ans CD
i think correct answer is C & D

choices.C: It ensures that spoke-to-spoke traffic no longer needs to flow through the tunnels through the hub.
choices.A: It creates redundant tunnels between hub-and-spokes, in case failure takes place on the primary links.
choices.B: It dynamically assigns cost and weight between the hub and the spokes, based on the physical distance.
choices.D: It provides direct connectivity between all sites by creating on-demand tunnels between spokes.

discussion.content: Correct is A and C.

comments.content:
B - sourceip in the member config is to specify the healthcheck source ip. 
D - not member config
Answer is definitely AC

discussion.content:
B, and C
Source IP (source-ip-based): All traffic from a source IP is sent to the same interface (Page 25)
priority: You can set the priority of the interface that can be used for SD-WAN rules or priority rules. (Page 30)

Selected Answer: AC
AC refer to SD-WAN_6.4_Study_Guide page 30

Selected Answer: AC
ANSWER IS A,C 
D is not part of the member config.

comments.content: ... but priority is not part of an SDWAN rule. Priority is used when a static route is created towards the virtual-wan-link - the member interface then uses the priority as the priority for its static route.

discussion.content: I would say that cost isn`t correct, because is used in the following strategies: Lowest Cost and Maximize Bandwidth, but here is source-ip. I think is C & D
